filmography.title: A Double Life
filmography.role_description: A lonely waitress who becomes the tragic victim of an actor who gets too immersed in his role as Othello.
filmography.plot: An actor's mind becomes affected by the character he portrays, leading him to strangle a waitress he meets.

filmography.title: Cry of the City
filmography.role_description: The loyal ex-girlfriend of a fugitive criminal who tries to help him evade the police.
filmography.plot: A career criminal on the run tries to clear his name and protect his family while being hunted by a determined police lieutenant.

filmography.title: Winchester '73
filmography.role_description: A dance hall girl who is forced out of town and gets caught in the crossfire of a feud over a prized rifle.
filmography.plot: A cowboy's obsession with a prize-winning rifle leads him on a chase through the Wild West.

filmography.title: A Place in the Sun
filmography.role_description: A plain, clingy factory worker whose pregnancy threatens the social climbing ambitions of her lover.
filmography.plot: A poor boy gets a job working for his rich uncle and ends up falling in love with two women, with disastrous results.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: He Ran All the Way
filmography.role_description: A lonely girl who unwittingly brings a cop-killing fugitive home to her family.
filmography.plot: A thief on the run takes a family hostage in their own apartment after meeting their daughter at a swimming pool.

filmography.title: Phone Call from a Stranger
filmography.role_description: An aspiring actress and one of the passengers on a doomed flight, whose story is told to her family by a survivor.
filmography.plot: The survivor of a plane crash visits the families of his fellow passengers to comfort them and learn about their lives.

filmography.title: Executive Suite
filmography.role_description: The secretary and mistress of a company executive who gets caught up in the boardroom power struggle.
filmography.plot: When a powerful CEO dies suddenly, a boardroom power struggle erupts to determine his successor.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Special Jury Prize (Ensemble)

filmography.title: The Night of the Hunter
filmography.role_description: A gullible widow who marries a sinister preacher, unaware that he is a serial killer hunting her children's hidden money.
filmography.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid the $10,000 he'd stolen.

filmography.title: The Big Knife
filmography.role_description: A troubled Hollywood starlet who threatens to expose a studio cover-up.
filmography.plot: A Hollywood actor wants to quit the business to save his marriage, but a studio boss blackmails him into staying.

filmography.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
filmography.role_description: The vain, fearful, and quarrelsome woman hiding in the annex with the Frank family.
filmography.plot: Two Jewish families hide from the Nazis in a secret annex in Amsterdam during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Odds Against Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: The supportive girlfriend of a racist ex-convict who is planning a bank heist.
filmography.plot: A desperate ex-cop, an indebted nightclub singer, and a racist ex-con team up to rob a bank.

filmography.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
filmography.role_description: A mother battling drug addiction who tries to save her son from following in his executed father's footsteps.
filmography.plot: The son of an executed criminal tries to escape his impoverished, crime-ridden neighborhood with the help of his mother.

filmography.title: The Young Savages
filmography.role_description: The mother of a boy accused of a gang murder, who was also the former girlfriend of the prosecuting DA.
filmography.plot: An assistant DA investigates the racially charged murder of a blind Puerto Rican boy by a gang of Italian-American teens.

filmography.title: Lolita
filmography.role_description: The deluded, culture-vulture mother who marries Humbert Humbert, unaware he is obsessed with her daughter.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet.

filmography.title: The Chapman Report
filmography.role_description: An adulterous housewife who participates in a sex survey and confronts the emptiness of her affair.
filmography.plot: A group of women volunteer for a sex survey, leading them to re-examine their own romantic lives.

filmography.title: The Balcony
filmography.role_description: The madam of a brothel where customers act out elaborate power fantasies while a revolution rages outside.
filmography.plot: In a brothel during a revolution, patrons play out their fantasies of being figures of power.

filmography.title: A Patch of Blue
filmography.role_description: A cruel, racist mother who abuses her blind daughter and tries to keep her isolated.
filmography.plot: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man, who becomes determined to help her escape her abusive home life.

filmography.title: Alfie
filmography.role_description: A voluptuous, wealthy American widow who briefly turns the tables on the womanizing Alfie.
filmography.plot: An unrepentant ladies' man gradually begins to understand the consequences of his lifestyle.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Harper
filmography.role_description: An aging, alcoholic former starlet connected to a missing persons case.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper is hired by a wealthy woman to find her missing husband.

filmography.title: Wild in the Streets
filmography.role_description: The hysterical mother of a rock star who becomes President and puts everyone over 30 into concentration camps.
filmography.plot: A rock singer becomes President of the United States and lowers the voting age to 14.

filmography.title: Buona Sera, Mrs. Campbell
filmography.role_description: The wife of one of three American GIs who might be the father of an Italian woman's daughter.
filmography.plot: Three American men return to Italy for a reunion, unaware they have all been paying child support for the same girl for 20 years.

filmography.title: Bloody Mama
filmography.role_description: The monstrous matriarch of a crime family who leads her sons on a violent spree.
filmography.plot: The story of Ma Barker and her four sons, who terrorized the South in the 1930s.

filmography.title: What's the Matter with Helen?
filmography.role_description: A disturbed mother of a convict who moves to Hollywood with another mother to start a dance school, but is haunted by the past.
filmography.plot: Two women whose sons were convicted of a notorious murder move to Hollywood to open a talent school.

filmography.title: The Poseidon Adventure
filmography.role_description: A heroic Jewish grandmother who sacrifices herself to save others during an underwater escape.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape when their ocean liner completely capsizes at sea.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Next Stop, Greenwich Village
filmography.role_description: The overbearing, guilt-tripping Jewish mother of an aspiring actor in 1950s New York.
filmography.plot: An aspiring actor leaves his parents' home in Brooklyn to live in Greenwich Village in the 1950s.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress; BAFTA: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: The Tenant
filmography.role_description: A grumpy building concierge who adds to the protagonist's paranoia in Roman Polanski's psychological thriller.
filmography.plot: A bureaucrat rents a Paris apartment where he finds himself drawn into a rabbit hole of dangerous paranoia.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Pete's Dragon
filmography.role_description: The nasty, singing matriarch of a hillbilly family trying to recapture the orphan Pete.
filmography.plot: An orphan boy and his magical dragon come to town and live with a lighthouse keeper and his daughter.

filmography.title: The Portrait of a Lady
filmography.role_description: The eccentric aunt of the protagonist in this adaptation of the Henry James novel; one of her final roles.
filmography.plot: A young American woman travels to Europe and becomes a victim of her own innocence and the machinations of others.
